instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1278: What is A1278? A1278 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook or Macbook Pro Unibody from years Late 2008, Mid 2009, Mid 2010, Early 2011, Late 2011, Mid 2012 with EMC 2254, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-2327, 820-2530, 820-2879, 820-2936, 820-3115..
definitions.820-2327: What is 820-2327? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.LVDS_IG_BKL_ON: What is LVDS_IG_BKL_ON? LVDS_IG_BKL_ON is equivalent to LCD_BKLT_EN. This signal usually goes to an LED driver used for creating a power rail for the LCD screen backlight, to tell it to turn on & create this rail. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2008 no backlight and picture
threads.message:
backlght chip area bit water damaged, no too bad, i replaced the chip, the lcd connector, fuse, the laptop works with ext monitor.

The lcd is not recognised, 

<TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR> 2. pin is high 3.3V which means that the backlight is not enabled by SMC, so the quiestion why it doesn recognise the LCD?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2008 no backlight and picture
threads.message:
"no backlight and picture"
Clarify that please; missing image too?
If has image, then LCD is recognized and problem is only backlight related.
If no image, then check voltage for J9000, pins 2/3, 4, 5, 6.
Be sure all the traces of J9000 are OK.
Also check solders and integrity of nearest components.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2008 no backlight and picture
threads.message:
i got new cable and screen, replaced the lcd connector on the board, there is picture but no backlight

replaced the backlight chip too

i think the issue could be the SMC

<TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR> pin 2 is 3.3V   pin 5 is 0V
<TRANSISTOR>Q9806</TRANSISTOR> pin 3 is 12V which i think should be less than 12V to open, its a PNP transistor

so <TRANSISTOR>Q9806</TRANSISTOR> pin 1-2-5-6 is zero, the whole backlight circuit is not powered

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2008 no backlight and picture
threads.message:
<TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR> needs 3V at pin 5 too.
Only then <TRANSISTOR>Q9806</TRANSISTOR> can drive voltage to L9701, through <RESISTOR>R9730</RESISTOR>.
<SIGNAL>LVDS_IG_BKL_ON</SIGNAL> comes from MCP79, not from SMC.
Tied pin 3/<TRANSISTOR>Q9807</TRANSISTOR> to ground and check for backlight...

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2008 no backlight and picture
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2008 no backlight and picture
threads.message: are awas water damaaged, had to run cable between <RESISTOR>R9723</RESISTOR> and chip,

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2008 no backlight and picture
threads.message:
Check if all traces are OK; especially passing holes to other side.
Also check all resistors arount <CHIP>U9701</CHIP>.
Did you try known good LCD assembly?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2008 no backlight and picture
threads.message:
yes, before there was no picture and no backlight, now there is picture and no backlight, the original lcd cable had corrosion or burn on the 2 pins where the lcd main power goes in, i think the original screen backlight is shorted also

i dunno, do u see something on the picture i uploaded?

i will try another backlight chip maybe, it gets the power but wont boost the 12V to higher voltage (it supposed to be 35V??)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2008 no backlight and picture
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R9724</RESISTOR> doesn't look too good; seems to have damaged terminal.
Nothing was connected to pin 9/<CHIP>U9701</CHIP>?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2008 no backlight and picture
threads.message:
<RESISTOR>R9723</RESISTOR>  1.2M ohm resistor was  corroded, the voltage divider did not work, i dont have the same donor board, so i found a 1M resistor, not 1.2M, now there is backlight and picture, but i think only every second LED is on in the backlight so the bottom of the screen has those patches of dark , tried other screen same issue, but it is usable now.

Is the board controlling the LED `s oin the screen? the lcd voltage is 26V now

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2327</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> 2008 no backlight and picture
threads.message:
Backlight voltage is correct now; aprox 25V for all <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1278</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>.
Check if all LED return resistors are good.
